Dan Campbell Makes Lions' Plan on Resting Players Moving Forward Very Clear
The Detroit Lions are on a roll.
Sitting atop the NFC at 13-2, a win this week against the San Francisco 49ers, paired with a Green Bay Packers win over the Minnesota Vikings, would [ensure that the Lions have the top seed in the NFC](https://www.si.com/nfl/week-17-nfl-clinching-scenarios-how-five-teams-can-punch-playoff-ticket), and the first-round bye that comes with it, before a snap of football is played in Week 18.

Given that the Lions donâ€™t play until Monday night, and thus will know the outcome of the Packers-Vikings game before taking the field, thereâ€™s a scenario that Detroit knows their game in San Francisco does not matter, and could sit their starters. Any extra bit of rest, whether it came in Week 17 or 18, would be a boon for the Lions, as [theyâ€™ve been dealing with a slew of injuries on defense](https://www.si.com/nfl/lions-lose-three-key-defensive-players-to-brutal-injuries-in-loss-to-bills).
However, Lions coach Dan Campbell doesn't sound like he plans to rest any players this week, regardless of the outcome of the Vikings game. That's not the Lions way.

Even though they have a hurt team, [Campbell is still confident](https://www.si.com/nfl/dan-campbell-honest-admission-mindset-amid-lions-injury-issues) the Lions can make a deep run.
